Discharge Instructions: Dear , It was a pleasure taking care of you during your stay at . WHY WAS I IN THE HOSPITAL? -You fell and broke your acetabulum -Your oxygen was very low WHAT WAS DONE WHILE I WAS IN THE HOSPITAL? -You were seen by the orthopedic surgeons and your fracture was managed conservatively -You were given oxygen and inhaled medicines to help with your severe lung disease (COPD) WHAT SHOULD I DO WHEN I LEAVE THE HOSPITAL? -Continue to work with -Try to limit your pain medicine usage to only when needed for severe pain -Take your inhalers as prescribed -Monitor for any bleeding on your new blood thinner, if you have a lot of bleeding, you may ask your doctor about other blood thinning medications -Continue to use the incentive spirometer to open up your lungs Be well!
